extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 lb arugula, tough stems discarded and leaves chopped (6 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: 1/2 lb arugula, tough stems discarded and leaves chopped

extendedIngredients.name: garlic cloves
extendedIngredients.original: 3 large garlic cloves, thinly sliced lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: lemon zest
extendedIngredients.original: 1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest

title: Green Beans and Arugula
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Green Beans and Arugulan a try. One serving contains 84 calories, 3g of protein, and 5g of fat. For 79 cents per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 6. If you have olive oil, pepper, garlic cloves, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 diet. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 25 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 70%, this dish is good. Try Arugula Salad With Potatoes and Green Beans, Arugula Salad With Green Beans And Radishes Recipe, and Snap Peas and Green Beans with Arugula-Mint Pesto for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Cook beans in a 6-quart pot of boiling salted water, uncovered, until tender, 4 to 6 minutes. Drain in a colander.                                                                Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then sauté garlic, stirring, until golden, about 1 minute. Add beans, arugula, zest, salt, and pepper and cook, tossing, until arugula is wilted, about 2 minutes.

steps.step: Cook beans in a 6-quart pot of boiling salted water, uncovered, until tender, 4 to 6 minutes.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then sauté garlic, stirring, until golden, about 1 minute.
Add beans, arugula, zest, salt, and pepper and cook, tossing, until arugula is wilted, about 2 minutes.
